author: pratikpc
body:
Currently [Microsoft Store has PowerShell 7.1.0](https://www.microsoft.com/en-in/p/powershell/9mz1snwt0n5d)

Today, PowerShell 7.1.1 was released.

Would it be possible to update the Microsoft Store version?

Would it be possible to automate the Microsoft Store releases?

comments.author: kilasuit
comments.body:
@pratikpc there is a potential 3 day lead time for the release on here to be pushed through the windows store publishing checks as per previous issues raised on this 
like https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/13615 & https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/7730 particularly the comment https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/7730#issuecomment-689732223 

Can you please close this as there's nothing we can do to change this and you will just need to wait it out (like I am) I'm afriad

Regarding your questions

> Would it be possible to update the Microsoft Store version?

It's in flight already by automated processes

> Would it be possible to automate the Microsoft Store releases?

As an automation language the build and release mechanism is already automated to the best level of optimisation that the team can currently manage for all the things in their direct control, as well as those outside their direct control (like the publishing process for the Microsoft store)

comments.author: pratikpc
comments.body:
@kilasuit thank you > A new PowerShell stable release is available: v7.1.1 Upgrade now, or check out the release page at: https://aka.ms/PowerShell-Release?tag=v7.1.1 I just received this message and thought something was wrong I had no idea!!
GitHub
Release v7.1.1 Release of PowerShell · PowerShell/PowerShell
7.1.1 - 2021-01-14 General Cmdlet Updates and Fixes Avoid an exception if file system does not support reparse points (#13634) (Thanks @iSazonov!) Make AppLocker Enforce mode take precedence over ...

title: Update Microsoft Store version of PowerShell
